      • setThreadExecuter

        protected void setThreadExecuter(org.threadly.concurrent.SubmitterExecutorInterface sei)
        Description copied from class: Client
        This is used by the SocketExecuter to set the ThreadExecuter this client is supposed to use. The ThreadExecuter works in a single threaded manor to keep all the client operations in order. This might need to be exposed to your package but in general You should not be assigning this or changing it.
        Overrides:
        setThreadExecuter in class Client
        Parameters:
        sei - the ThreadExecuter to use for this client.

      • getChannel

        public java.nio.channels.SocketChannel getChannel()
        Description copied from class: Client
        Returns the SocketChannel for this client. If the client does not have a SocketChannel it will return null (ie UDPClient).
        Specified by:

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Description copied from class: Client
        Returns if this client is closed or not. Once a client is marked closed there is no way to reOpen it. You must just make a new client.
        Specified by:
        isClosed in class Client
        Returns:
        true if the client is closed, false if the client is connected.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: Client
        closes this client. Any pending writes when this is called will just be dropped.
        Specified by:
        close in class Client

      • addReadBuffer

        protected void addReadBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
        Description copied from class: Client
        This is for the SocketExecuter. Once a read is done from the socket this is called. This call should also make a call to addReadBufferSize(int size).
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • writeForce

        public void writeForce(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
        Description copied from class: Client
        This write basically forces the client to go over its maxBufferSize. This technically does not have to be implemented by the client and can be dangerous if done incorrectly.
        Overrides:
        writeForce in class Client
        Parameters:
        bb - the ByteBuffer to write to the client.

      • writeTry

        public boolean writeTry(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
        Description copied from class: Client
        This will try to write a ByteBuffer to the client. If the current writeBuffer size is less than the Max buffer size this will return true. Otherwise you will get a false. If a false is received the buffer *will not* write to the socket unless you call another write again. It should be noted that either full parseable packets should be written at a time or some other form of locking should be used.
        Overrides:
        writeTry in class Client
        Parameters:
        bb - the ByteBuffer to write to the client.
        Returns:
        true if the client has taken the ByteBuffer false if it did not.

      • writeBlocking

        public void writeBlocking(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
        Description copied from class: Client
        This write will block until the write can be done. This block will only happen if the clients current writeBuffer size is more than the set maxBuffer. This block will persist either until the clients writeBuffer is less than the maxWriteBuffer or the client is closed. Care should be taken when using this. The pending writes for the client will happen on another unblockable thread but if a lot of clients use there read thread to write and block its possible to consume all threads in the pool. This is only a problem if the thread pool is reading/writting from both sides of a client connection using the same thread pool.
        Overrides:
        writeBlocking in class Client
        Parameters:
        bb - the ByteBuffer to write.

      • setReader

        public void setReader(Client.Reader reader)
        Description copied from class: Client
        This sets the Reader for the client. The Reader is called every time a new read is added to the client Each time a Reader is called it should call .getRead() *once* on the client
        Overrides:
        setReader in class Client
        Parameters:
        reader - the Reader interface to set for this client.

        Overrides:

        Returns:
        the current Reader for this client.

      • setCloser

        public void setCloser(Client.Closer closer)
        Description copied from class: Client
        This sets the Closer interface for this client. Once set the client will call .onClose on it once it a socket close is detected.
        Overrides:
        setCloser in class Client
        Parameters:

      • getProtocol

        public SocketExecuterBase.WireProtocol getProtocol()
        Description copied from class: Client
        This is used by the SocketExecuter to help understand how to manage this client. Currently only UDP and TCP exist.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
